block.p: Nicole Gail Tell, the daughter of Barbara and Victor Tell of Charlotte, N.C., is to be married this afternoon to Richard Dean Thau, the son of Adrienne and Herbert Thau of Roslyn, N.Y. Rabbi Bonnie Steinberg is to officiate at Land's End, a restaurant in Sayville, N.Y. Chief Judge Marilyn Hall Patel of the Federal District Court for the Northern District of California will take part in the ceremony.

The bride, 29, a former clerk to Judge Patel, is a litigation associate at Patterson, Belknap, Webb & Tyler, a Manhattan law firm. She graduated from Vassar College and received a law degree magna cum laude from Fordham University. Her father, a jazz musician, retired as a music teacher from Public School 175 in Rego Park, Queens.

Nicole Gail Tell, the daughter of Barbara and Victor Tell of Charlotte, N.C., is to be married this afternoon to Richard Dean Thau, the son of Adrienne and Herbert Thau of Roslyn, N.Y. Rabbi Bonnie Steinberg is to officiate at Land's End, a restaurant in Sayville, N.Y. Chief Judge Marilyn Hall Patel of the Federal District Court for the Northern District of California will take part in the ceremony.

The bride, 29, a former clerk to Judge Patel, is a litigation associate at Patterson, Belknap, Webb & Tyler, a Manhattan law firm. She graduated from Vassar College and received a law degree magna cum laude from Fordham University. Her father, a jazz musician, retired as a music teacher from Public School 175 in Rego Park, Queens.

The bridegroom, 35, is the president and a founder of Third Millennium, a nonprofit organization in Manhattan specializing in public policy issues for those born in the 1960's and 70's. He graduated from Haverford College, and is an editor of ''Generations Apart: Xers vs. Boomers vs. the Elderly'' (Prometheus Books, 1997), an anthology about generational conflicts. His father is the president of Herball Covers, which makes protective covers for trucks and outdoor equipment in Brooklyn.
